item.title: Deb add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Deb add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Deb add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Deb add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Deb add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Deb add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Deb add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Deb add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Deb add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Deb add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Deb add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "Books are not about passing time. They're about other lives. Other worlds. Far from wanting time to pass, one just wishes one had more of it. If one wanted to pass the time one could go to New Zealand." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Deb add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "A book is a device to ignite the imagination." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Deb add a quote by Steven Galloway
item.description: "By the time the last few notes fade, his hope will be restored, but each time he's force to resort to the Adagio it becomes harder, and he knows its effect is finite. There are only a certain number of Adagios left in him, and he will not recklessly spend this precious currency. " -- Steven Galloway

item.title: Deb add a quote by Steven Galloway
item.description: "She felt an enveloping happiness to be alive, a joy made stronger by the certainty that someday it would all come to an end. Afterward she felt a little foolish, and never spoke to anyone about it. Now, however, she knows she wasn't being foolish. She realizes that for no particular reason she stumbled into the core of what it is to be human. It's a rare gift to under stand that you life is wondrous, and that it won't last forever. " -- Steven Galloway

item.title: Deb add a quote by Elizabeth Berg
item.description: "There are random moments - tossing a salad, coming up the driveway to the house, ironing the seams flat on a quilt square, standing at the kitchen window and looking out at the delphiniums, hearing a burst of laughter from one of my children's rooms - when I feel a wavelike rush of joy. This is my true religion: arbitrary moments of of nearly painful happiness for a life I feel privileged to lead." -- Elizabeth Berg

item.title: Deb add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Reading good books ruins you for enjoying bad books." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Deb add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer & Annie Barrows
item.description: "I think you learn more if you're laughing at the same time." -- Mary Ann Shaffer & Annie Barrows

item.title: Deb add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Deb add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Music was my refuge. I could crawl into the space between the notes and curl my back to loneliness." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Deb add a quote by Leopold Stokowski
item.description: "A painter paints pictures on canvas. But musicians paint their pictures on silence." -- Leopold Stokowski

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Music is the language of the spirit. It opens the secret of life bringing peace, abolishing strife." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Deb add a quote by Kelly White
item.description: "You have to, take a deep breath. and allow the music to flow through you. Revel in it, allow yourself to awe. When you play allow the music to break your heart with its beauty." -- Kelly White

item.title: Deb add a quote by ROBERT FROST
item.description: "I am not a teacher, but an awakener." -- ROBERT FROST

item.title: Deb add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "So much universe, and so little time." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Deb add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I have no use for people who have learned the limits of the possible." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Deb add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Deb add a quote by Haven Kimmel
item.description: "Mother always said she was a size 7 woman she kept wrapped in fat to prevent bruising." -- Haven Kimmel

item.title: Deb add a quote by Haven Kimmel
item.description: "I later discovered that in order to be a good athlete one must care intensely what is happening with a ball, even if one doesn't have possession of it. This was ultimately my failure: my inability to work up a passion for the location of balls." -- Haven Kimmel

item.title: Deb add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Time for you and time for me, And time yet for a hundred indecisions, And for a hundred visions and revisions, Before the taking of a toast and tea." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Deb add a quote by Alexander McCall Smith
item.description: "The telling of a story, like virtually everything in this life, was always made all the easier by a cup of tea." -- Alexander McCall Smith
